intro: Mnesithea pubescens, commonly known as the hairy mnesithea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and private collections.
